intro: Oenothera guadalupensis subsp. clementina, commonly known as the Guadalupe evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. The species is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance to local pollinators.
